fields.description: Some subset of TestDFSStripedOutputStreamWithFailure tests almost always fail in test-patch runs. Since its failure is no longer seen as a blocker for commit, it should be disabled until it is more reliable.

This message was automatically generated.

Here's a patch which uses {{assume}} to skip the tests that I've seen failing (the "parameterized" ones, and testBlockToken). I ran the parent and a few subclasses and they passed locally.

Chris, does this work for you? Do you want anything else excluded?
If the other tests are still relevant and stable, then sure, let's try this. +1, assuming Jenkins comes back clean.

This message was automatically generated.

This seems to be working since the DFSStripedWithFailure tests aren't showing up anymore, though there are still tons of other failures.

I'll commit this as an incremental improvement. Thanks for the review Chris!
Pushed to trunk and branch-3.0, thanks again all.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #12849 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/12849/])
HDFS-12417. Disable flaky TestDFSStripedOutputStreamWithFailure. (wang: rev 80ee89b2871ce2b4b7387de6e410f53d798dfd0b)
